quizzes.title: History Quiz: Barbie and Following
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, bullet, barbie. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: During the 1990s Barbies waist was widened.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What statement about James Thurber and Dorothy Parker is true?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were humorists.

questions.question: What pattern of bullet holes did Sherlock Holmes create on the interior wall of his lodgings, apparently just for pistol shooting practice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: VR (for Victoria Regina)

questions.question: What is the first name of Ruth Handlers daughter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barbara

questions.question: What was the name of the Mattel fashion designer who created Barbies clothes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlotte Johnson

questions.question: When was an 18 Supersize Barbie, with a Superstar face, first made?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1978

questions.question: At home, where did Sherlock Holmes keep his smoking tobacco?

options.text: In an engraved silver tobacco tin
In the toe of a Persian slipper

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the toe of a Persian slipper

questions.question: When were the first Barbie dolls released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1959

questions.question: Barbies boyfriend Ken first appeared in 1961.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who wrote the modernist poem The Waste Land?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: T.S. Eliot

questions.question: Which of these plays were written by Arthur Miller?

options.text: Strange Interlude and Desire Under the Elms
The Night of the Iguana and The Rose Tattoo
The Skin of our Teeth and Our Town
The Crucible and Death of a Salesman

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Crucible and Death of a Salesman

questions.question: Which of these Barbie dolls debuted in 1971?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malibu Barbie

questions.question: Where is the gemstone found in the Sherlock Holmes story The Adventure of the Blue Carbuncle?

options.text: Inside a plaster bust of Napoleon
It is never found, having been thrown into the Thames.
In a cardboard box, tied up with tarry string

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inside a Christmas goose

questions.question: Ernest Hemingways writing style is characterized by which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: understatement and terseness

questions.question: Who wrote the Southern Gothic novel Absalom, Absalom!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Faulkner

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: U.n.c.l.e. and Man
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, headquarters, centaur. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Langston Hughes wrote poetry, plays, and novels.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Every episode of The Man from U.N.C.L.E. had this word in its title.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Affair

questions.question: In The Man from U.N.C.L.E., THRUSH stands for Technological Hierarchy for the Removal of Undesirables and the Subjugation of Humanity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: According to a theory revealed in The Man from U.N.C.L.E. novels, THRUSH was started by Nazi war criminals that had fled to South America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What country was Illya Kuryakin from on the TV show The Man from U.N.C.L.E.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russia

questions.question: Rabbit, Run and The Centaur were both written by Bernard Malamud.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Some of Willa Cathers novels deal with frontier life on the Great Plains.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: On The Man from U.N.C.L.E., when at the headquarters all agents had to wear badges. What number was Illya Kuryakins badge?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: In the title The Man from U.N.C.L.E., U.N.C.L.E. stands for United Nations Control for Law Enforcement.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Call of the Wild and The Sea Wolf are novels by John Steinbeck.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: A major theme of The Great Gatsby is the corruption of American innocence through the pursuit of wealth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What chess piece was on Paladins calling card?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Knight

questions.question: I am in a dark room. I have a candle, a wood stove, a gas lamp and a match to light, which all can drive away darkness. What to light first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The match

questions.question: What secret organization did U.N.C.L.E. battle on the TV show The Man from U.N.C.L.E.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: THRUSH

questions.question: Where was the secret entrance to the New York offices of U.N.C.L.E. on the TV show The Man from U.N.C.L.E.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A tailor shop

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Paladin and Paladins
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, kind, services. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was Paladins first name on the show Have Gun — Will Travel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What was the name of Paladins favorite bellhop at the hotel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hey Boy

questions.question: When visiting India, what did Paladin do that made the natives respect him?

options.text: took his shoes off when he entered the Taj Mahal
saved the life of the princess
saved the life of a native

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: killed a man-eating tiger

questions.question: Where did Paladin get his education?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Point

questions.question: In what city did fictional character Paladin live?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Francisco

questions.question: Each morning I appear
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Your shadow

questions.question: They do not have feathers, or flesh, or scale, or bone. Yet they have fingers and thumbs of their own. What are they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: gloves

questions.question: Golden treasure am I, guarded by hundreds and thousands of armed guards. I am stored in a labyrinth where no man can walk, yet men often come to steal my gold. What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: honey

questions.question: Gleaming and glittering down I thrust a sparkling spear, I never rust. What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: icicle

questions.question: Whats as big as the biggest camel and weighs nothing at all?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: shadow

questions.question: How much did Paladin typically charge for his services?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $1,000

questions.question: What on earth could dance, and live and die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fire

questions.question: What kind of camel can jump higher than a tree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: any kind of camel

questions.question: Paladin got into the gunfighting business while trying to settle a gambling debt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What did Paladin carry in his boot when he was traveling?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fine cigars

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Gene Kelly and Webkinz World
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, co-star. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Im one of five, and Im not alive.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A stone

questions.question: Kinzcash is the measurement of money in Webkinz World.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: I am related to the water but I am not wet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a mirror

questions.question: I have eight to spare, in case I lose my one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a cat

questions.question: What country awarded Gene Kelly the Legion of Honor in 1960?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: American fur trapper Hugh Glass made a cross-country trek after being mauled by a grizzly bear.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was Gene Kellys co-star in The Pirate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judy Garland

questions.question: What Kinztunes track starts out: Life on the farm is a life for me. Im a happy piggy with a piggly family...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Piggy Plum Pie

questions.question: Gene Kelly quit dancing when he was eight and didnt dance again until he was fifteen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: John Jacob Astor, the first multi-millionaire in the United States, started out as a fur trader.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What musical film directed by Gene Kelly starred Barbra Streisand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hello, Dolly

questions.question: Webkinz World came up with a new room theme for which event?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2010 FIFA World Cup

questions.question: In what year was Gene Kelly born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1912

questions.question: In the Webkinz Kinzstyle outlet, what is PJs real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pollie Jean Collie

questions.question: What is the name of the newspaper in Webkinz World?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Kinzville Times

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Tigers and Webkinz World
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, lakes, ground. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Theres no recess at Kinzville Academy in Webkinz World.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What did the Tungusic people of Siberia and northern China call the Siberian Tiger?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both of these

questions.question: Who is the cheerful brown dog at Webkinz Stadium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fred Rover

questions.question: The Caspian tiger is extinct.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Webkinz signature raccoon comes with what item along with the big city window?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Limo

questions.question: In Webkinz World, what is the Red Squirrels favorite food?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peppermint pinecone

questions.question: Tigers like to spend time in pools.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is tigers lifespan in the wild?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 10-15 years

questions.question: Which animal is pictured on the front of all Webkinz adoption tags?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A cocker spaniel

questions.question: Tigers sometimes carry their dead prey across lakes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The South China tiger is extinct.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Do tigers kill other predators?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What is a group of tigers called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Streak

questions.question: The tiger is the national animal of which of the following countries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India

questions.question: Tigers cannot easily walk over broken or thorny ground.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nancy Drews and Redline
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athlete, profession. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is the director of the 2007 movie Redline?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andy Cheng

questions.question: What color is Nancy Drews convertible?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue

questions.question: What is the profession of Nancy Drews aunt Eloise in New York in the popular book series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teacher

questions.question: What make and model of car was impounded by the police in the movie Redline?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ford GT

questions.question: What are the names of Bess Marvins and George Faynes boyfriends in the Nancy Drew stories?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave and Burt

questions.question: Nancy Drews sleuthing sidekicks, Bess Marvin and George Fayne, are of what relation to Nancy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No relation

questions.question: How old was fictional character Nancy Drew when her mother died?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three years old

questions.question: In what car does Jason pick up Carlo from the bus station in the movie Redline?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ferrari F430 Spider

questions.question: Which of these cars does not appear in the film Redline?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bugatti Veyron

questions.question: What is the name of the river than runs through Nancy Drews fictional hometown?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Muskoka River

questions.question: Nancy Drew often used aliases when solving mysteries. Which of the following is NOT an alias that was used by Nancy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anna Martin

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a villain in one of the Nancy Drew Mystery Stories?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dick Milton

questions.question: Nancy Drews boyfriend Ned Nickerson is a member of which fraternity at Emerson College?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Omega Chi Epsilon

questions.question: Nancy Drews tall, handsome boyfriend is quite the athlete. In addition to being a football star, Ned Nickerson also plays on the varsity teams of what other two sports at Emerson College?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baseball and basketball

questions.question: What is the name of Nancy Drews pet terrier?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Togo
